ATTACK_ID: Required. Use date without dashes + first 3 letters of location + a counter number (for multiple attacks)
DESCRIPTION: Description of the event
TOTAL_DEATHS:
Include perpetrators
Assume to add # of perpetrators if not confirmed.
AFFILIATION: Who is the attack affiliated with?
OFFICIAL_OR_INSPIRED: Was attacker an official member or sympathizer?
SURVEILLED: Are the attackers known members of groups?  (TRUE/FALSE)
PRIOR SUSPICION:
Was there any suspicion of attacker before incident of Attack?
(TRUE/FALSE)

DESCRIPTION: A priest's throat was slit and four nuns were taken hostage in a church in Rouen, France. The IS-linked Amaq news agency said "two soldiers of the Islamic State" had carried out the attack. The two terrorists were shot dead by the French authorities. One of the men was known to the French intelligence services (as reported by French TV channel M6) and was on the French government's terror watch-list, known as the S list.[248]

A suicide bombing outside a wine bar in Ansbach, Germany, in which a bomber tried to bomb a large music festival going on at the time. After detonation, he injured 15, 4 seriously. Many videos were discovered of him pledging allegience to ISIL and Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. The bomber was the only fatality.[247]

A 17-year-old Afghan refugee injured five people seriously, two critically, with a knife and hatchet on a train near Würzburg. The attacker was shot dead when he attacked the arriving police officers.[246]

A coordinated attack involving suicide car bombers, suicide bombers on foot, and gunmen against the mausoleum of Muhammad ibn Ali al-Hadi, a Shi'ite holy site in Baghdad, killed at least 56 people and injured 75. ISIL claimed responsibility.[245]
A suicide bomber has attacked a police station in Central Java, killing himself and injuring a police officer.[244]
Baghdad bombings Two coordinated bomb attacks killed over 300 people and injured over 221 others.[243]

Gunmen killed 20 hostages. 13 hostages were rescued, two police officers, and six terrorists were killed. One terrorist is in custody. ISIL has claimed responsibility, but according to Bangladeshi officials, the attack was carried out by homegrown militant group Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh.[242]
Assassination of Amjad Sabri, claimed by a splinter group of the Pakistani Taliban who accused Sabri of blasphemy.[241]
ISIS Soldier infiltrates refugee camp at a Jordanian army post near Rukban, killing 6 and wounding 14.[239] ISIL later claimed responsibility.[240]
Two French citizens, a police officer and his wife were stabbed to death in Magnanville, France by a man swearing his allegiance to ISIL.[238]

49 people were killed and 53 injured in a mass shooting at a nightclub in Orlando, Florida. The shooter, Omar Mateen, pledged allegiance to ISIL by specifically calling police and journalists several times during the incident.[236][237]
At least 40 people were killed and 60 injured in a car bomb attack on a market in Baghdad. ISIL claims responsibility.[235]

Two gays rights activists were hacked to death in the capital of Bangladesh, Dhaka. An Al-Qaeda affiliated group claimed responsibility for the attacks and stated they killed the two as they were "pioneers of practicing [sic] and promoting homosexuality in Bangladesh".[233][234]

Attackers hacked a university professor to death in the city of Rajshahi, Bangladesh. ISIL claimed responsibility for the attack stating that they assassinated him "for calling to atheism in the city of Rajshahi in Bangladesh".[231][232]

The April 2016 Kabul attack targeted a security team responsible for protecting government VIPs in Kabul, Afghanistan. The attack killed 64 people and wounded 347. It was the Taliban's biggest attack on an urban area since 2001.[230]

The 2016 Lahore suicide bombing targeted Christians who had gathered on Easter in Gulshan-e-Iqbal Park. The blast, by Jamaat-ul-Ahrar, a Pakistani Taliban faction, killed at least 70 people and injured 300 others.[228][229]
Three ISIL suicide bombers strike security checkpoints in the Yemeni city of Aden, killing 26 people.[224][225]
30 people killed and 95 injured after a suicide bomber blew himself up at a football stadium in Iskandariya, south of Baghdad. ISIL claimed responsibility for the attack.[226][227]
2016 Brussels bombings includes two suicide bombings in Brussels Airport and one bombing in Brussels Metro that resulted in 35 deaths and more than 300 wounded.[223]
In Anbar, Iraq, ISIL suicide bombers kill at least 24 at municipal building[222]
In the 2016 Grand-Bassam shootings Al Qaeda gunmen stormed 3 hotels in the beach resort city of Grand-Bassam in the Ivory Coast, leaving 18 people dead.[221]
Boko Haram gunmen raided a Nigerian village, at least 65 people were killed and 136 others injured.[220]
Suspected Boko Haram insurgents have blown themselves up in a market in Cameroon, killing at least 25 people and injuring 62 others.[219]
Al-Shabab attack on beachside restaurant leaves 20 dead.[218]
At least 22 killed in attack on Bacha Khan University, Pakistan. The Taliban claim responsibility for the attack.[217]
In the El Adde attack, Al-Shabaab terrorists attack a African Union Kenyan army base in El-Adde. 63+ killed, several injured.[215]

In the 2016 Ouagadougou attack Islamist gunmen armed with heavy weapons attacked the Cappuccino restaurant and the Splendid Hotel in the heart ofOuagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso. 20+ killed. 15+ injured.[216]
In the 2016 Jakarta attacks 4 assailants kill 2 and injure 24 in a terrorist attack in Jakarta. The attack was orchestrated and financed from ISIL in Syria.[214]
In the 2016 Istanbul bombing an ISIL suicide bomber kills 10 tourists and injures 15 more in the historical centre of Istanbul.[213]
Anti-government militants fired a rocket at a primary school in Bak District, Khost Province, killing three students and wound eight others. No group claimed responsibility.[28]
A 15-year old Turkish ISIL supporter attacked a teacher from a Jewish school in Marseille with a machete. 1 injured.[211]
ISIL gunmen detonate suicide vests in a shopping mall, killing at least 20 and wounding more than 40 people.[212]

A double blast at a cafe north of the Iraqi capital claimed another 20 lives in the late afternoon in the town of Muqdadiyah northeast of Baghdad. A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-rigged vehicle after people gathered at the scene. IS claimed the attack and named the suicide bomber as Abu Abdallah, an Iraqi. The security officers said that Shiites set alight several Sunni homes and a mosque following the attack.[27]
Two huge bomb blasts, one at a teashop and the other at a mosque, killed at least 100 people in the township of Sharaban in Iraq's northern Diyala province.

DESCRIPTION:
Sectarian attacks have continued by forces associated with the Iran-backed militias of the Badr Brigades and Asa’ib Ahl al-Haq (League of the Righteous) – attached to the Popular Mobilization Forces – burned an office compound and houses, killing at least 26 people.
7 Sunni mosques were burned (some reports indicate more mosques were targeted)
Local citizens have reported abductions, torture, and summary executions of Sunnis in the area since January 11.
An additional two people, a reporter and cameraman for al-Sharqiya TV, a channel critical of the militias, were killed in the provincial capital of Ba’quba after reporting on the attacks.
In the 2016 Hurghada attack two militants armed with a melee weapon and a signal flare stormed the Bella Vista Hotel. 3 injured.[210]
WEAPON_USED: KNIFE (thing used in attack, others assumed to be foiled)/POSSIBLE FIREARMS/SIGNAL FLAIR/POSSILBE SUICIDE DEVICE

DESCRIPTION: In the Zliten truck bombing Islamist militants detonated a truck bomb at the police training camp al-Jahfal in the coastal town of Zliten, Libya. 50+ dead 100+ wounded.[207]
In the January 2016 Paris police station attack an Islamist from Morocco wearing a fake explosive belt attacked police officers with a meat cleaver. He was shot dead.[208]
A car bombing at a checkpoint in the Libyan oil port of Ras Lanuf left seven people dead and 11 wounded.[209]
A Militant drove a truck packed with explosives to the armored gates of a compound for civilian contractors near Kabul's airport before detonating. 30 people injured, including children.[206]
Five Islamist suicide bombers attack an Iraqi military base. 15 dead and 22 injured.[205]
In the 2016 Pathankot attack suspected Jaish-e-Mohammed militants attacked an Indian air base killing 7 security force members. Several injured.[204]
A Taliban suicide bomber detonated himself in a French restaurant called 'Le Jardin' in Kabul. 2 dead 15 injured.[203]

A suicide bomber detonated his explosives in the front entrance of a regional branch of the National Database and Registration Authority in the northwestern city of Mardan, Pakistan. The blast killed 26 people and more than 50 were wounded.[201]

Gunmen opened fire on a group of local residents who were visiting a viewing platform at the fortress in Derbent, Dagestan, southern Russia, killing one and injuring 11. ISIL claims responsibility.[202]
A Taliban suicide bomber killed at least one person and wounded 33 in an attack on a road near a school close to Kabul International Airport.[199]

14 female suicide bombers aged 12–18 attempted to simultaneously attack the city of Maiduguri. Seven of the bombers were shot dead by Nigerian forces while three managed to escape and detonate themselves in Baderi general area and near a Mosque, killing 26 people and wounding another 85. One of the surviving attackers was apprehended.[255]

DESCRIPTION: A millitant detonated his explosives in a truck at an Iraqi position near the Saudi border. 6 dead, 14 injured.[194]

In the Tell Tamer bombings three truck bombs by ISIL killed up to 60 people and injured more than 80 in the town of Tell Tamer.[192]

An explosive device by Islamists targeting a military convoy went off in Rafah. 4 dead 4 injured.[189]
The governor of the southern port city of Aden in Yemen, Jaafar Mohammed Saad, was killed in a car bomb attack. The assassination was claimed by ISIL.[186]
Four female suicide bombers from the militant Islamist group Boko Haram attacked the Chadian island of Koulfoua on Lake Chad, killing at least 15 people and injuring 130.[185]

In the 2015 San Bernardino attack, married couple Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik shot and killed 14 people and injured 22 others in a killing spree that the FBI was investigating as "act of terrorism".[183][184]
Islamist gunmen killed four security personnel in an attack at a police checkpoint in Saqqara. 4 dead[181]
Militants fired rockets on a MINUSMA peacekeeping forces base in northern Mali. Ansar Dine claimed responsibility. 3 dead, 20 wounded.[182]
21 killed in Boko Haram suicide attack on a Shia procession in Nigeria[180]
Boko Haram invades a village and shoots indiscriminately residents and also fire rockets, killing 18.[179]
At least 12 people were killed in a bus bombing in Tunis, the capital of Tunisia. ISIL claimed responsibility for this attack that targeted a bus transporting members of the Presidential Guard.[177]

In the November 2015 Sinai attack which occurred a day after the second round of parliamentary elections closed, militants attack a hotel housing election judges in the provincial capital of al-Arish in Egypt's North Sinai. 7 dead, 10+ wounded[178]
8 people among women and children demise when a female suicide bomber is reduced to pulp.[176]
Suicide bombers affiliated with Boko Haram kill at least 10 in northern Cameroon.[175]

A Malaysian national is beheaded by Abu Sayyaf in the southern Philippines.[170]

2015 Parramatta shooting. A NSW Police Force civilian employee was shot dead outside NSW Police Force headquarters on Charles Street, Parramatta, Sydney by a 15-year old lone gunman. The gunman then engaged with NSW Police Special Constables in a shootout before being killed, 2 dead.[153]
